targetString: N’olw’omugaso gw’okwewaayo kuno ate n’omulimu gwo ku nsonga eno, tujja kubaako enkyukakyuka ze tukola mu ngeri gye tukolamu okutandika ne wiiki eyo ejja.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Okukyusakyusa mu mirimu n’enteekateeka zaffe

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Nga Robyn bwe yagamba emabegako awo, akakiiko kaasisinkanye mu kiro ekyayise okwogeraganya ku nkola yaffe n’enteekateeka yaffe enaagobererwa mu nnaku n’emyezi egijja.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Mu mboozi yaffe, twayogedde ku kye tulowooza nti y’engeri gye twandyeteeseteeseemu olw’obuzibu bwe twolekedde n’engeri esinga obulungi ey’okukuuma ekitongole okubeera nga kitambula mu kiseera kino.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Ffenna wamu twayagadde okweggyako okunyigirizibwa tuwagire ekyetume kyaffe okumala ebbanga eriwera.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’oyagala okuddamu okukuba, tewali buzibu.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Eri abakozi bonna, bakontulakita, n’abakozi ab’ekiseera:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: tusuubira okukola essaawa 4 buli lunaku oba essaawa 20 mu wiiki okutuusa lwe tunaddamu okukyusa eyo gye bujja.

sourceString: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: Tetulangiridde luwummula – bw’oba ng’osobola okukola okusinga ku ssaawa ezo, ekitongole kino kisobola okukukozesa.

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: Wabula, mu kiseera kino kati ensi teteeberezeka era bw’oba ng’oyagala kulabirira baagalwa bo, okugula ebyokukozesa ewaka, oba okugenda mu ddwaliro, bw’obeera omulamu naffe kye tusinga okwagala.

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: Tetugenda kulondoola budde bwo.

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’oli mulwadde, tokola.

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
targetString: Kino twandibadde tetukyogerako naye tulabye nga kisaana okwogerako.

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: Ennaku z’okulwala oba okusasulwa olw’obutaba ku mulimu tebyetaagisa – tegeeza butegeeza maneja wo era oyambe b’okola nabo okukyusa mu by’otegese okukola okukakasa nti ebitegekeddwa okukola byonna bifiibwako.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: (Bw’okeberwa n’osangibwa ng’olina COVID-19, tegeeza Bryan ku T&C Ops know so T&C akuwe obuyambi obwetaagisa era ajja kufuba okulaba nti obeera bulungi era ng’ofuna obuyambi obwetaagisa okuva mu bukulembeze bwaffe).

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: Abakolera ku buli ssaawa bajja kusasulwa mu bujjuvu.

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: Tukyogeddeko, era twongera okukiggumiza wano nti tujja kussa ekitiibwa mu bye twetema eri bakontulakita baffe ne bannaffe abatukolera buli ssaawa.

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: Buli muntu ajja kusasulwa okusinziira ku ssaawa ze eza bulijjo mu mbeera eza bulijjo.

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: Muno mulimu n’okutunuulira ekiseera bw’oba ng’oli mulwadde oba nga tosobola kukola.

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’oyagala okukola, tukuwagira.

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: Abantu bangi bakozesa emirimu ng’omukutu gw’okweggyako okunyigirizibwa okuva mu bantu/ebintu ebibeetoolodde.

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: Bye tukola bimatiza era bivaamu ebibala naddala mu kiseera ekiringa kino.

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: Nkiddamu wano nti kiri gy’oli okwerabirira.

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: Kye tukusaba kye kino nti yogera ne mukama wo tumanye kye tuyinza okusuubira era tukyuseemu nga bwe kyetaagisa.

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: Emirimu egimu gitwalibwa okubeera egy’omugaso ennyo.

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: Waliwo ebintu ebitalina kuyimirira.

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Okuba obulungi, ne tiimu z’okusonda (n’ebirala) bikola emirimu egy’enjawulo egyetaaga obuyambi obulala.

sourceString: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
targetString: Tuja kutandika kaweefube w’okwekaliriza ebigendererwa byaffe mu kiseera kino era tuseetule bye tutunuulidde kati tusobole okuwagira ebikulu mu bye tukola.

sourceString: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: Tulina bingi eby’okukola, kye twetaaga kwe kwemalira ku pulojekiti ezisinga obukulu.

sourceString: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
targetString: Okukendeeza ku mbiro tekijja kutukosa gye bujja.

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: Tetuteekateeka “kukubisaamu budde bwe tukolera nga tusasulira bwe tufiiriddwa” nnawookeera ng’aweddewo.

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: Tosuubirwa kukolera budde busukka ku obwo bw’obadde okoleramu olw’okukwata nsalessale atasoboka.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: Tukkiriza nti embeera ekyuse, era tujja kukola ebiruubirirwa ebiggya tukyuse ne nsalessale we kinaaba kyetaagisiza.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: Kiki ekinaakolebwa ku Nteekateeka y’Omwaka (Annual Planning)?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: Okukyusa okudda mu mbeera y’obulamu gye tunaabaamu, n’ebisuubirwa mu budde obukolerwamu buli lunaku, tusuubira okukyusaamu mu nnaku za nsalessale ku ebyo bye twagala okutuukako mu Nteekateeka y’Omwaka gwaffe 2020-2021.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: Ekigendererwa kyaffe kwe kuteesa okwongezaayo enteekateeka yaffe eya 2019-2020 kituwe obudde obulala okukoleramu embalirira abakozi basobole okukulembeza emirimi emikulu, okwerabirira, n’okulabirira abantu baabwe ate ng’era tufaayo ne ku abo abaagala okukolera obudde obutonoko mu wiiki entonotono ezijja.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: Okwongezaayo kuno kikendeereza ddala enteekateeka eriwo ku mirimu n’okupeekebwa okumaliriza emirimu okuliwo mu kiseera kino mu kitongole kyonna.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: Tujja kwanjula ebiteeso byaffe eri Olukiiko Olufuzi mu wiiki ejja era tujja kutegeeza abakiise n’abalala ku bye tulina okuzzaako nga bwe tunaaba tumaze okubikakasa.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: Mwebale nnyo bannange mwenna olw’Enteekateeka n’olw’obukulembeze mu nsonga zonna.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: Embeera ya woofiisi, okubozi bw’okusiigibwa, n’okuyonja

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Wiiki ewedde, twategeezebwa nti omu ku bannaffe ow’omu San Francisco alabika yasiigibwa akawuka ka COVID-19.

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: Wabula, mu kwegendereza okungi, twafuna eddagala eritta obuwuka ne tufuuyira ekifo kyonna n’ebintu mu woofiisi y’omu San Francisco.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: Baakozesa eddagala erikozesebwa okutta obuwuka mu malwariro okutta obuwuka ku buli kintu, mu kifo ewatuukirwa, ebikondo by’omu lifuti ebituuka ku mwaliiro gwa woofiisi yaffe.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: Bannannyini kizimbe nabo baakozesa engeri zaabwe ez’okulabirira abakozi baabwe.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: Tuwulira emirembe nti woofiisi ejja kuba nteeketeeke bulungi we tunaasalirawo okuddayo okukola.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: Woofiisi yaffe ey’omu DC eri mu WeWork, era ng’ekifo ekyo kitulaze ku nteekateeka yaakyo ey’okulwanyisa COVID-19 era n’abakozi bonna ab’omu kifo ekyo enteekateeka eno bagigunyeeko.

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: Wiiki ewedde we yaggweerako, woofiisi yaffe ey’omu DC yajjululwa n’ezzibwa mu kifo ekyesuulidde ddala ewala nga tugoberera okuluŋŋamizibwa kwa San Francisco.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: Era nga bannaffe abamu ab’omu NYC bwe bamanyi, tubadde mu kwogerezeganya tupangise ekifo mu Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: Okwogerezeganya kuno kukyagenda mu maaso naye kuyinza okulwisibwa.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: Abamu ku bannaffe bakolera waka ate nga guno gwe mulundi gwabwe ogusoose.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: Abamu ku bannaffe be tukolaganye nabo ebbanga mu ngeri eyo bakimanyi nti kirimu okusoomooza, era bandyagadde okubaako amagezi ge bawa:

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: Enkiiko muzikuumire mu bbanga eriri wakati w’essaawa emu oba bbiri.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: Okusisinkanira ebbanga eddene bwe kuba kwetaagisa, tunula mu ngeri ensisinkana ezo gye zisobola okukutulwakutulwamu ne zidda ku nnaku ez’enjawulo.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: Buli lukiiko luteekeko ensonga, tegeka ebyokuteesaako era weereza ebyetaaga okusomako ng’obudde bukyali.

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: Viidiyo gye muba mukulembeza nga mukozesa n’ebirala nga Google Docs ne Zoom okuyambako mu kuwuliziganya okwo okw’obuliwo.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: Mubeere n’omuntu akulemberamu buli lukiiko, omuntu alina okulondoola okwogeraganya n’ebibuuzo ne biweebwa ekiseera era n’okulondoola abalina okwogera ate n’omuntu alina okunokola ebiteesebwa (oba n’okukkaanya mwenna ne mubaako bye munokola).

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: Bw’oba nga weetaaga emizindaalo gy’omu matu, weereza email eri abakola ku bya tekinologiya bakuweereze emizindaalo emirungi.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: Kozesa ssente ezikuddizibwa okubeera obulungi ogulemu obumpwakipwaki.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: Weeyunge ku mukutu gwa #remoties mu Slack oyogereganye ne banno ku bikwata ku mirimu egigabiddwa

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: Ekitongole Ekikola ku nsonga z’Abakozi kitunula mu nsonga y’okuwuliziganyiza ku yintaneeti (webinar-based ergonomics guidance) okusobola okuyambako ku mirimu egigabiddwa mu Kitongole kyonna.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: Mu wiiki eyo ewedde, twasaba abaafuna ssente z’okukola emirimu basazeemu emikolo gyonna egisasulirwa Wikimedia gamba nga editathons, okutuusa ng’ekitongole kya WHO kirangiridde nti nnawookeera aweddewo.

sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: Twabategeeza nti tukitegeera bulungi nti okubasaba okusazaamu n’okukugira ebintu ebimu kizibuwaza okukola ku byokukola ebimu bye baategeka era nti tewali muntu ajja kubonerezebwa olw’okulwawo okumaliriza oba okukyusaamu mu byategekebwa.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: Mu wiiki eyo ejja, tujja kulondoola okuluŋŋamizibwa okulala ku Wikimania ne ku ssemasomo nnamiramwa ate n’ezo ez’omu bitundu ebirala.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: Kye tusinga okulaba mu bannaffe wonna mu nsi kiri nti bannaffe banakuwavu olw’okusazaamu okw’engeri eyo naye ate bawewuka bwe bateegeera nti balina kwemalira ku ebyo eby’omu kitundu kyabwe, Wikimedia n’ebirala.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: Mu ebyo ebijja mu maaso, CRT ekola butaweera okuteekawo omuko ku Meta-Wiki okuteerawo abantu ebbanga okulondoola engeri gye bakwatiddwako n’okugoberera ebyempuliziganya yaffe nabo.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: Okubeera mu mpuliziganya ku nsonga ezikwata ku COVID-19

sourceString: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: Tujja kubayita nga tuyitira mu kalenda zammwe mu lukiiko olw’enjawulo ku Lwokuna olujja, ku ssaawa 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT.

sourceString: We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: Tujja kukosesa ekiseera kino okugabana ku nsonga endala, okwanukula ebibuuzo byammwe era tumaleyo obudde butonotono nga tunyumyamu.

sourceString: We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: Ensonga eno tugirimu ffenna era ffenna tulina okuyambagana mu ngeri yonna esoboka.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: Ebyo nga biri awo, osobola okusanga obubaka buno ku email ne ku mikutu emirala egiriko obubaka obwekwanya ku COVID-19, ne ku Office Wiki.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: CRT kijja kufuba okuteeka obubaka obwakasembyeyo okufunika mu kifo kimu.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: Tufuba era okukola okufuna empuliziganya buli kiseera n’abakozi abali mu mawanga agakoseddwa ennyo mu kiseera kino.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’olina ekibuuzo kyonna ku bikwata ku ntambula, emikolo, omulimu gwonna oba okusoomoozebwa ku kukola ku by’olina okukolako, oba ekintu ekirala kyonna kye weetaaga okukuyambamu, tolonzalonza kututegeeza era kolagana ne CRT.

sourceString: We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: Tuli bulindaala okuyamba n’okukolagana naawe ku nsonga eyeetaagisa.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’olina ensonga ey’ekyama oba ey’okwegendereza, tukusaba oweereze email ewa Bryan Judan, Ssenkulu w’Emirimu mu Nsi Yonna (Director of HR International Global Operations).

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: Enkyukakyuka zino zonna teziteekeddwa kulabika ng’ezitusuuzaawo emirimu gyaffe n’obuvunaanyizibwa.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: Wabula, zituyamba okutegeera nti mu kiseera kino, emirimu gyaffe n’obuvunaanyizibwa oboolyawo birina okukyukamu okwawukanako ku bwe kibadde emabega.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: Ebigobererwa bino tukkiriza nti byetaagisa okusobola okuwagiragana tusobole okugenda mu maaso nga tukola, okuwagira ekibiina kyaffe mu ngeri yonna eyeetaagisa, n’okuweereza abantu n’obuweereza kwe beesigamye.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: Emirimu gye twategeka gijja kubaawo nga gitulindiridde ekiseera bwe kinaatuuka.

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: Mu kiseera kino, kisaana nnyo okuyambagana era tuteekewo ebbanga ery’okukoleramu emirimu emikulu egijja mu wiiki ezijja mu maaso eyo oboolyawo n’emyezi egijja.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: Mwenna tubeetaaga okusobozesa kino okubaawo, noolwekyo tubeetaaga mwenna okwerabirira ne famire zammwe musobole okubeera mu mbeera ennungi nga tubeetaaze.

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
targetString: Kaakati, bambi – naaba mu ngalo era teweekwata mu maaso!

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, ne Tony S), n’abakulembeze abalala (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, ne Toby N).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: Ekirungo ky’omubiri ekya b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) kye kirungo ekyekutte kungulu (ku lususu lw’obutaffaali) ku butaffaali mu mawugwe, emisiwa, omutima, ensigo, n’ebyenda.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 erwanyisa ebyo ebikolebwa ekirungo kya angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) nga ekendeezaobungi bwa angiotensin-II eno nga bw’eyongeza Ang(1-7) okukifuula eddagala eriyinza okweyambisibwa okulwanyisa endwadde z’omutima. ACE2 era kikola ng’ekitandikirwako okuyingira mu butaffaali ku coronavirus ezimu.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Mu bantu ekirungo kino kitera kuyitibwa hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Ekirungo ky’omubiri ekya b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 kirimu zinc omuli metalloenzyme ekisangibwa ku ngulu kw’obutaffaali bw’omumusaayi n’obutaffaali obulala.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: ACE2 protein alimu N-terminal peptidase M2 domain ne C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 kiyita ku lususu oluliraanye omubiri omulundi gumu, nga ebirungo byakyo ebikulu birabikira ku ngulu ku butaffaali mu mawugwe n’ebinywa ebirala.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Ekifo ky’okungulu ekya ACE2 eggibwa ku lususu n’etambuzibwa ekirungo ekirala ekimanyiddwa nga sheddase, era olwo amazzi agavaamu aga protein ne gaweerezebwa mu musaayi ate oluvannyuma ne gafuusibwamu omusulo.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 kisangibwa mu bitundu by’omubiri ebisinga: ACE2 yekutte ku lususu lwa butoffaali naddala obw’okumawugwe ag’ekika II ku bisenge by’amawugwe, ebisenge bw’ekyenda ekitono, emisiwa n’obutaffaali obw’emisiwa egitambuza omusaayi, n’obutaffaali bw’ebinywa by’emisiwa mu bitundu by’omubiri ebisinga.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: Ekirungo ACE2 mRNA era kisangibwa ne ku kasusu akabikka ku bwongo, akawompo, hypothalamus, n’ekikolo ky’obwongo.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: Omugaso omukulu ogwa ACE2 kwe kutereeza ACE

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE yeekwata ku angiotensin I hormone mu vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 olwo yo ne yeekwata ku carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine okuva ku angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) n’ekisaabululira mu vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 era kisobola okwekwata ku bujegere obw’enjawulo omuli [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, ne ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 era afuga entambula y’akasusu akatambuza neutral amino acid SLC6A19 era nga kirumirizibwa okuba nti kiviirako obulwadde bwa Hartnup.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Nga protein etambulizibwa ku kasusu, ACE2 enkola nga omulyango omukulu oguyingira mu butaffaali eri obuwuka bwa corona obumu, omuli HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (akawuka akalwaza SARS); ne SARS-CoV-2 (akawuka akalwaza COVID-19).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Okusingira ddala, okwekwata kwa spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV ne SARS-CoV2 ku kirungo ekikulu ekya ACE2 ku ngulu ku butaffaali kiviirako okuyingiza akawuka n’ebirungo okuva mu kifo kyabyo ne bidda mu bisenge by’obutaffaali.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Enkola eno ey’okuyingira era yeetaaga okutanula S protein n’ekirungo kya serine protease TMPRSS2, nga okunuusibwa kwakyo kuli mu kwekkeneenyezebwa okulaba oba nga kisobola okukozesebwa mu bujjanjabi. Kino kiviiriddeko abamu okuteebereza nti bw’okendeeza obungi bwa ACE2, mu butoffaali, kiyinza okuyambako okulwanyiisa okukwatibwa ekirwadde.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: Wabula, ebitongole by’abaguku eby’enjawulo n’ebitongole ebiruŋŋamya biwagira okugenda mu maaso ne ACE inhibitor emanyiddwa wamu n’obujjanjabi bwa ARB.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Okwekenneenya okulambike obulungi n’ebyasunsulwa okuva mu kunoonyereza kw’ekikugu okwafulumizibwa nga July 11, 2012, kwazuula nti "okukozesa ACE inhibitors kyali kyekuusa ku bitundu 34 ku 100 mu kukendeeza obulabe mu lubyamira okusinga ku birala ebyateekebwako

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: So ng’era, "obulabe bwa lubyamira bwakendeera mu balwadde abaali bajjanjabiddwa ne ACE inhibitors abaali bayinza okwanguyirwa okufuna lubyamira, naddala abo abaagongobala n’abalwadde b’omutima

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: Okukozesa ACE inhibitors era zaalowoozebwa okukendeeza ku bantu abafa lubyamira, newankubadde nga ebyavaamu tebyali bya maanyi ng’ate obulabe obuleetebwa lubyamira"

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) erowoozebwa okuba enzijanjaba ebaluseewo ey’okukosebwa ennyo okw’amawugwe, era yalabika okulongoosa mu kwekwata kw’emisiwa n’entambuza y’omukka gw’okussa mu bubizzi obuto obwalina obulwadde bw’amawuggwe obwa lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Okukendeera kwa rhACE2 mu bantu kutwala essaawa 10 ate okukola kutandika mu ddakiika 30 nga kwotadde n’ekiseera kye kimala okukola (ebbanga erimalibwa) lya ssaawa 24.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Ebizuuliddwa okuva mu kunoonyereza okwenjawulo biraga nti rhACE2 liyinza okuba eddagala eriwa essuubi eri abo abatasobola kugumira classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) oba mu ndwadde nga okutambula kwa angiotensin II kwongeddwamu amaanyi.Infused rhACE2 lyekenneenyezebwa mu kugezesa kw’ekisawo mu kujjanjaba endwadde ezeekuusa ku mawugwe.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: App za b'COVID-19 ze app za software w’okumasimu g’omu ngalo ezikolebwa okuyambako mu kulondoola abantu ababa bakwataganyeeko n’abalwadde mu kulwanyisa akawuka nawookeera aka coronavirus 2019-20, kwe kugamba enkola ey’okuzuulamu abantu (abakwataganyeeko n’omulwadde”) abayinza okuba nga baakwataganyeeko n’omuntu omulwadde.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: App ez’enjawulo zaakolebwa oba okusembebwa, n’obuwagizi bwa gavumenti obutongole mu bitundu n’amatwale ag’enjawulo.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Enkola ez’enjawulo ez’okuzimbirako app ezirondoola abakwataganyeeko n’abalwadde zikoleddwa.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Ensonga za twekisize zoogeddwako, naddala ku miyungiro egy’esigamiziddwa ku kulondoola ebifo abantu abakozesa app we bali.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Enkola endala ezitaliimu kulingiriza kungi mulimu okukozesa amayengo ga Bluetooth okukwasaganya essimu y’omukozesa omu n’endala ezimuli okumpi

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Nga 10 April 2020, Google ne Apple byalangirira nti bajja kukwasaganyiza wamu okuwagira app nga eya Bluetooth mu Android ne iOS butereevu mu miyungiro gyabwe gye bakozesa.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: Mu China, gavumenti ya China, ng’ekolaganira wamu ne Alipau, bataddewo app esobozesa bannansi baabwe okukebera oba nga babaddeko n’abantu abalina COVID-19.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Ekozesebwa mu bibuga bya China ebisoba mu 200. Mu Singapore, app eyitibwa TraceTogether y’ekozesebwa.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: App yakolebwa aba IT ab’omu kitundu, n’efulumizibwa ng’esobola okukozesebwa buli muntu era ejja kukwasibwa gavumenti. North Macedonia yatandikawo "StopKorona!", app ya Bluetooth okulondoola abeetabyeko n’abantu abasuubirwa okuba n’obulwadde n’okuweereza amangu obubaka eri abajjanjabi n’ab’obuyinza.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: App yakolebwa Minisitule y’Ebyempuliziganya ne Tekinologiya wamu ne Minisitule y’Ebyobulamu.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: We zaatuukira 14 April 2020, nga app erinze kukakasibwa Google Play Store ne Apple App Store.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Nga 12 April, gavumenti yalaga nti app erondoola abakwataganyeeko n’abalwadde yali ku mutendera ogusembayo ogw’okukolebwa, era ejja kuba etuuse okutandika okukola mu wiiki ntono. App eyeefaananyiriza eyo eteekebwateekebwa mu Ireland, ne mu France ("StopCovid").

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australia ne New Zealand zirowooza ku app eziri ku TraceTogether app ya Singapore ne BlueTrace protocol.Russia eteekateeka kutandikawo app ya geofencing ey’abalwadde abazuuliddwamu COVID-19 ababeera mu Moscow, ekoleddwa okukakasa nti tebava waka.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Ross Anderson, pulofeesa mu kuyiiya tekinologiya akwata ku byokwerinda (security engineering) mu Ssettendekero lya Cambridge University, yamenya ebizibu ebisobola okubaawo n’emiyungo egy’esigamiziddwa ku app, omuli n’okulowooza nti zikoze bulungi n’obusobozi bw’obutakola bulungi singa app eyo eba ekozesebwa abantu babale.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: Okugonjoola obuzibu bwa app za “coronavirus” eziwabya oba ez’obulabe, Apple yateekawo obukwakkulizo u bika bya bitongole ki ebisobola okugatta app ezeekuusa ku coronavirus ku App Store yaabwe, nga bakkiriza ebyo byokka “ebitongole” oba ez’ebitongole ebimanyiddwa.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Google ne Amazon nabo bataddewo obukwakkulizo bwe bumu.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Abalwanirira obwa twekisize baalaga okweraliikirira kwabwe ku biyinza okuva mu kulondoola abantu abangi abakozesa app za coronavirus, okusingira ddala okwebuuza oba nga okulondoola okwazimbibwa okukola ku nsonga za nnawookera wa kunaasaanyizibwawo nga ekirwadde kiweddewo.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Amnesty International n’ebitongole ebirala ebisoba mu 100 byayisa ekiwandiiko nga bisaba wabeewo obukugire ku nkola y’okulondoola ey’ekika kino.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Ebitongole byalangirira obukwakkulizo munaana ku puloojekiti za gavumenti:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: okulondoola kulina kubeera “mu mateeka, nga kwetaagisa era nga kwa kigero”;

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: okwongezaayo okulondoola n’okulondoola kulina okubaamu obuwaayiro obwogera ku ddi lwe kunaggwa;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: Obubaka bujja kukozesebwa ku byekuusa ku COVID-19 byokka;

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: okukuuma data n’obutaasanguzibwa bilina okukuumibwa era kino kikakasibwe n’obujulizi;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: okulondoola okwa kompyuta kulina okwewala okwongera okusajjula ensonga ezeekuusa ku busosoze n’okuboolebwa ;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: okugabanna obubaka n’abantu abalala kilina okutaputibwa mu mateeka;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: walina okubeerawo enkola ezitangira eddembe ly’abantu okutyoboolebwa wamu n’eddembe lya bannansi okwerwanako nga basosonkerezeddwa;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: okwetabamu okutegeerekeka okwa bonna "abakwaatibwako" kujja kwetaagisa, nga omwo mwe muli okw’abajjanjabi abakugu mu mbeera z’abantu n’ebibinja by’abantu ababoolebwa. German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) ne Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) nabo baafuulumya eby’okugoberera.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: Enteekateeka ya Google/Apple eyateesebwa eruubirira okusalira amagezi ekizibu ky’okulondoola okutakoma nga baggyamu enkola y’okulondoola ku byuma byabwe bw’eneeba nga tekyetaagisa.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: Ensi ezimu zaakozesa essimu okulondoola omuntu waali mu kifo kya app, okwewala okuwanula app ate n’obusobozi bw’okwewala okulondoolwa.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: Mu Israel, okulondoolera ku ssimu kwe kwakkirizibwa.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: Enkola z’okulondoolera ku ssimu eziwa obubaka bw’ekifo kyennyini omuntu w’aba ali bulina obulabe bwa maanyi ku bikwatagana n’okwekisiza.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
targetString: Wabuli, si nti emiyungo gyonna egirina server ez’awamu gyetaaga okuba n’olukusa okumanya ekitundu omuntu mw’ali; emiyungo egiwerako egikuuma ebyama giteereddwawo nga server ey’awamu ekozesebwa ku kuwuliziganya kwa munda.

sourceString: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
targetString: Mu South Korea, omuyungo oguteesigamizibwa ku app gwe gwakozesebwa okulondoola abantu abaakwataganako n’abalwadde

sourceString: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
targetString: Mu kifo ky’okukozesa app eyeetongodde, omuyungo gwakuŋŋanya obubaka okuva mu bifo eby’enjawulo omuli okulondoola obubaka bw’oku ssimu n’obubaka bwa kaadi ezikosebwa omuntu, ne bugattibwa wamu okuwandiika obubaka ne buweerezebwa ku ssimu eri abantu abasuubirwa nti bayinza okuva nga baasiigiddwa obulwadde.

sourceString: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko okukozesa obubaka buno okulabula abayinza okuba nga baakwataganako n’abalwadde, gavumenti era obubaka obukwata ku bifo abantu gye babeera ebufudde bwa lukale obusobola okufunibwa buli omu, ekintu ekyakkirizibwa olw’enkyukakyuka ezaateekebwa ku tteeka lya twekisize oluvannyuma lw’okubalukawo kwa MERS mu ggwanga.

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
targetString: Obubaka buno busobola okufunibwa eri abantu bonna okuyita ku app ne website ez’enjawulo. Amawanga omuli Germany gaalowooza ku kukozesa omuyungo ogw’awamu wamu n’egyo egikuuma obwa twekisize.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
targetString: Nga 6 Ogwokuna 2020, ebirambulukufu byali tebinnaba kufulumizibwa.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Okulondoola abantu abakwataganyeeko n’omulwadde kintu ekiteekeddwateekeddwa obulungi, nga kikoleddwaako okunoonyereza okuwera okuva eyo emabage mu 2013. Nga 7 Ogwokuna 2020, nga ebibinja by’abakugu ebiwerako bikola ku kulongoosa mu nkola za twekisize, okugeza nga okukozesa Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) okumanya agikozesa w’ali okusinziira ku masimu amalala.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: Wavula, PEPP-PT nkola ya kukwasiza wamu erimu enkola ey’awamu n’eyebiwayi, era tegoberera tteeka limu. Amateeka agaawuddwaamu mulimu Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols ne Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) n’amalala.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
targetString: Mu mateeka gano, ebyogera ku muntu ebisobola okumuzuuza tebiggyibwa ku kyuma, era okumukwasaganya kwonna kukolebwa awo.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Ekibinja kya Twekisize ku MIT Media Lab kibadde kibazeewo SafePaths, enkola eyitibwamu okukozesa obukodyo bw’okuba omwekusifu mu kunoonyereza n’okukozesa ekifo oba omukutu ogw’okutemaatema obubaka okulondoola ensaasaana ya COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Kwesigamiziddwa ku kunoonyereza okuva mu alipoota eyitibwa "Apps Gone Rogue: Okukuuma Ebyama byo mu Nawookeera” (Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic") eyafulumizibwa mu Gwokusatu 2020. Enkola endala eyeefaananyiriza ku eyo ye ya SafeTrace platform eya Enigma MPC, kkampuni eyiiya tekinologiya wa twekisize era nayo mu kusooka eyali esangibwa ku MIT Media Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: SafeTrace ezimbisa tekinologiya atalina bulabe okusobozesa abakozesa okugabana obubaka obw’ekyama ku kifo n’ebyobulamu byabwe n’abakozesa abalala wamu n’abakulembeze, awatali kuteeka mu buzibu kyama kyonna.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Nga 5 Gwokuna 2020, ekitongole ttabamawanga ekya TCN Coalition kyatandikibwawo ebibinja ebyegattira awamu nga bikozesa enkola efaanagana era n’amateeka agakwatagana, n’ekigendererwa eky’okukendeeza obubinja, n’okusobola okukwasaganyiza awamu okukola app ezirondoola n’okuweereza obubaka, ensonga enkulu ennyo mu kusobozesa abantu abangi n’okugyettanira.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Nga 9 Gwokuna 2020, gavumenti ya Singapore yalangirira nti yali ekozesa ku BlueTrace protocol ekozesebwa app ya gavumenti yaayo entongole.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Nga 10 Ogwokuna 2020, Google ne Apple, amakampuni agafuga platform z’amasimu eza Android ne iOS, baalangirira enkola ey’okulondoolamu abakwataganyeeko n’abalwadde, gye baagamba mbu ejja kukuuma obwa twekisize, nga yeesigamye ku kugatta tekinologiya wa Bluetooth Low Energy n’okuwandiika okwekyama ng’okozesa obubonero.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Era baafulumya ebikwata ku tekinologiya ow’enkizo akozesebwa mu muyungo.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Okusinziira ku Apple ne Google, omuyungo gusuubirwa okufulumizibwa mu mitendera esatu:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: okufulumya ebikola okusobozesa gavumenti okweteerawo app entongole ezirondoola akawuka ka coronavirus naye nga zeekuumira ebyama.

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: okuyunga obutereevu enkola eno mu nteekateeka za iOS ne AndroidGoogle ne Apple okusobola okugonjoola ebizibu ky’okuzikkirizisa n’okulondoola okutakoma nga basooka okugabana omuyungo guno okuyita mu kutumbula omuyungo oguyamba essimu okukola, n’oluvannyuma and later removing guggyibwemu nga obulabe buweddewo.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: b'Drug repositioning (era ekiyitibwa okuddamu okukozesa eddagala, re-profiling, re-tasking oba therapeutic switching) kwe kuddamu okukozesa eddagala eryakakasibwa okujjanjaba endwadde endala oba embeera y’omubiri okwawukanako ku eyo eyaluubirirwa olubereberye.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Kuno kwe kumu ku kunoonyereza okw’ekinnassaayansi okugobererwa mu kiseera kino okukulaakulanya obujjanjabi bwa COVID-19 obutaliimu bulamu era obukola obulungi.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okulala okugobererwa kulimu okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema COVID-19 ne convalescent plasma transfusion. SARS-CoV-2 erimu protein eziweebwa eddagala eziwera 66, ate nga buli emu ku zo erimu ligand binding sites eziwera.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Okwekenneenya binding sites ezo kiyamba mu kukulaakulanya eddagala erirwanyisa protein za COVID-19.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Ku protein ezizinga obukulu eza SARS-CoV-2 eziruubirirwa ze papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, ne ADP ribophosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A A, et al baanoonyereza ku compounds nnyingi eziruubirirwa omuli okwekaliriza enkula n’enfaanana y’eddagala erisinga obulungi eryakakaibwa okusobola okwanguya enkulaakulanya y’eddagala lya potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 mu kunoonyereza kwe okwakolebwa ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba kusembebwa mu nteekateeka y’okunoonyereza kw’ekisawo.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: Chloroquine ddagala erijjanjaba omusujja era erikozesebwa ku ndwadde ezeereetera obusibage (auto-immune diseases).

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Nga 18 Ogwokusatu, WHO kyalangirira nti chloroquine n’erifaafanana hydroxychloroquine linaaba mu ddagala ery’emirundi ena erinoonyerezebwako ng’ekitundu ku kugezesa Okw’okukolera awamu.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: Gavuna wa New York , Andrew Cuomo yalangirira nti okugezesa kw’eggwanga lya New York State okwa chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine kulitandika nga 24 Ogwokusatu. Nga 28 Ogwokusatu, ekitongole ki-FDA kyakkiriza okukozesa hydroxychloroquine sulfate ne chloroquine phosphate nga bagoberera okukkiriza okukozesa okw’amangu (Emergency Use Authorization, EUA).

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: Obujjanjabi tebunnaba kukakasibwa kugezesa kwa kisawo okw’ekitongole ki-FDA era nga lyakkirizibwa mu EUA mwokka ng’eddagala erigezesebwa okukozesebwa mu kiseera eky’amangu ku balwadde abaweereddwa ebitanda naye nga tebasobola kufuna bujjanjabi mu kunoonyereza okw’ekisawo.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: Ekitongole ki-CDC kyagamba nti "okukozesa, okuwa doozi, oba ebbanga hydroxychloroquine erya prophylaxis obujjanjabi bw’obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2" bwe bumala terinnaba kumanyika.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Abasawo bagambye nti bakozesa eddagala eryo nga "teali kirala kyakukola".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Ttiimu y’abanoonyereza mu Butuluuki mu Istanbul bakola okunoonyereza okutonotono ku nkozesa ya chloroquine nga liri wamu ne zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C ne vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okunene kutegekebwa ku Duke University ne University of Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: NYU Langone Medical School ekola okunoonyereza okw’okugezesa ku bulungi n’enkola y’okuziyiza eya hydroxychloroquine.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Okugezeza kw’omu China mu Wuhan ne Shenzhen kwalaga nti favipiravir lyali "likola bulungi ku bulwadde".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Abalwadde 35 mu Shenzhen baakeberwa nga tebalina bulwadde mu mukkati gwa nnaku 4, so ng’ate obulwadde bwamala ennaku 11 mu balwadde 45 abataafuna ddagala eryo.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa mu Wuhan ku balwadde 240 aba yegu, ekitundu ku bo baaweebwa favipiravir n’ekitundu ne bafuna umifenovir.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: Ekitongole kya Italian Pharmaceutical Agency kyajjukiza abantu obubaka obuliwo obuwagira eddagala eryo butono ate nga bwe busookerwako.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Nga 2 Ogwokuna, Germany yalangirira nti egenda kugula eddagala okuva mu eritekere era ekozese amagye okutwala eddagala eryo mu malwaliro ga yunivaasite eddagala gye linaakozesebwa okujjanjaba abalwadde ba COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: Okusinziira ku South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe yayanjulira obukulembeze bwa Trump administration ku kugula eddagala.Eddagala liyinza okuba nga terikola bulungi ku balwadde abayi alina akawuka akamaze okuzaalukana.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: Liyinza okubaamu obulabe okukozesebwa ku bakyala abalina embuto oba abo abaagala okufuna embuto.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Okunoonyereza okumu okwa lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), omugatte gwa antivirals lopinavir ne ritonavir, kwakubira nti "tewali muganyulo gwalabibwa".

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Eddagala lyategekebwa okuziyiza HIV okusaasaana nga kasibibwa ku protease.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Abanoonyereza ku University of Colorado bagezaako okukyusa eddagala okuzuula compound enaayamba okwegatta ne protease ya SARS-CoV-2.Waliwo okukolokotebwa mu kisaawe ky’ekinnassaayansi mu kuteeka ebikozesebwa mu kuddamu okukozesa eddagala eryayisibwa edda naddala eryakolebwa okujjanjaba HIV/AIDS.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: WHO lyassa ne lopinavir/ritonavir mu kugezesa kw’Okunoonyereza okw’awamu (international Solidarity trial).

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: Remdesivir lyakolebwa era ne likulaakulanyizibwa Gilead Sciences ng’obujjanjabi bw’akawuka k’obulwadde bw-Ebola ne Marburg virus. Gilead Sciences oluvannyuma kyazuula nti Remdesivir lyalimu antiviral activity in vitro mu kulwanyisa obuwuka bu-filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, ne corona- viruses .

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Ensonga emu ku bujjanjabi bw’akawuka kwe kukulaakulanya obusibage obuyitira mu kwekubisaamu obusobola okuleetawo endwadde endala n’okusaasaana.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okumu okwasooka okunoonyereza kw’ekisawo kulaga nti remdesivir liyinza okubaamu ekikugira obusibage mu nkula yaalyo. Waliwo okugezesa kw’ekisawo okutegekebwa, omwo nga mwe muli n’okw’emirundi ebiri okwakolebwa Amalwaliro ga Cleveland University; okulala kwa bantu abalina obulwadde obutali bwa maanyi n’okulala kwabo abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Waliwo okunoonyereza kw’ekisawo kwa mirundi esatu okukolebwa nga kwa intravenous vitamin C ku balwadde ba COVID-19 abaweebwa ebitanda era nga bayi ddala; okw’emirundi ebiri kulimu okukozesa eddagala likiguumaaza okugeraageranyizibwako (China, Canada) n’okumu tekuliimu kugeraageranya (Italy).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: Essaza lya New York State lyatandika okugezesa eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka erya azithromycin nga 24 Maachi 2020.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Ekitebe kya Japan ekya Japan National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) kiteekateeka okugezesa obujjanjabi bwa Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), eddagala erinuusibwa okukendeeza obulumi bw’olufuba, ery’okujjanjabisa abalwadde b’akawuka ka nawookera wa coronavirus naye nga tebannalaga bubonero.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: Engeri ya angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, Okunoonyereza okw’Omutendera II kutegekebwa omuli abalwadde 200 abalina okuggyibwa mu balwadde abayi abaaweebwa ebitanda mu Denmark, Germany, nr Austria okulaba enkola y’obujjanjabi.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: Abanoonyereza okuva mu Montreal Heart Institute mu Canada bekkaanya omulimu gwa colchicine mu kukendeeza okuzimba n’obuzibu bw’omusiwa (pulmonary complications) mu balwadde abalina abalumizibwa olw’obubonero obutonotono obwa COVID-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okuyitibwa COLCORONA, kuwandiisa abantu abakulu 6000 abalina emyaka 40 n’okusingawo abaakeberwa nga balina COVID-19 era nga balina obubonero obutonotono obuteetaaga kuweebwa bitanda.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Abakyala abalina embuto oba abayonsa oba abatalina nkola ya kwetangira mbuto tebakkirizibwa.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Anticoagulants nnyingi ezigezesebwa mu Italy.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: Low-molecular-weight heparin likozesebwa okujjanjaba abalwadde, ekyaleetera Ekitongole ky’Ebyeddagala mu Italy (Italian Medicines Agency) okufulumya ebigobererwa mu kulikozesa.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okukolebwa mu bifo ebyenjawulo ku balwadde 300 abanoonyereza ku nkozesa ya enoxaparin sodium ku prophylaxis ne doozi eziwonya kwalangirirwa nga 14 Ogwokuna.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 kawuka, okunoonyereza kw’ekinnassayansi okuwera kutunuulidde okuddamu okukozesa eddagala eryakakasibwa okujjanjaba obuwuka eryakolebwa olw’endwadde ezaabalukawo okusooka gamba nga MERS, SARS, ne West Nile virus.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribavirin: ribavirin lyasembebwa okujjanjaba COVID-19 okusinziira ku bigobererwa bya China eby’omulundi 7

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umifenovir: ribavirin lyasembebwa okujjanjaba COVID-19 okusinziira ku bigobererwa bya China eby’omulundi 7

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka (antibiotics) erirabiddwa ng’erisobola okuddamu okukozesebwa ng’erijjanjaba COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Lyakakasibwa China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu, okugezesa okukolebwa mu trials Italy ne China. era laba Tocilizumab#COVID-19.

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Eddagala erigema b'A COVID-19 ddagala erirowoozebwako obulowoozebwa okulwanyisa obulwadde bwa 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Weewaawo tewali ddagala ligema limazeeyo kiseera kya kugezesa kwa kisawo, waliwo okugezaako okuwerako okukwajja okukulaakulanya eddagala ery’engeri eyo.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: Ogwokubiri 2020 nga guggwaako 2020, ekitongole ki-WHO kyagamba tekisuubira ddagala ligema SARS-CoV-2, akawuka akaleeta obulwadde, okujja ku katale mu bbanga erikka wansi w’emyezi18.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: Eddagala eriruubira okugema lya mirundi etaanu lye lyali mu Mutendera I ogw’okunoonyereza okulaba obulabe mu Gwokuna.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: COVID-19 yategeerekeka mu Deesemba 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Nawookeera ow’amaanyi yasaasaana wonna mu nsi mu 2020, ekyaleetawo okusiga ssente nnyini ddala mu kunoonyereza olw’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ebitongole bingi bikozesa ebikwata ku kunoonyereza (genomes) ebyafulumizibwa okukulaakulanya eddagala eriyinza okugema SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kwatandikibwa mu Gwakuna, ebyetaagisa mu kaweefube wa CEPI ow’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema ze mbiro, obusobozi bw’okulikola, okukola eddagala mu bungi obwetaagisa n’okulibunyisa mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Mu Gwokuna, bannassaayansi ba CEPI baategeeza nti emikutu gya tekinologiya 10 egy’enjawulo gyali ku kunoonyereza na kukulaakulanya nga 2020 gwakatandika okutondawo eddagala erigema COVID-19.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: Emikutu egy’amaanyi egyajja mu Mutendera I ogw’okunoonyereza okulaba obulabe mulimu:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Omukulaakulanyi w’Omutendera I era omuluubirizi w’eddagala erigema: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: viral vector (Omukulaakulanyi w’Omutendera I era n’eddagala eriruubirirwa: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Nga bwe kyategeezebwa CEPI bannassaayansi mu Gwokuna, eddagala erigema eriruubirirwa lya mirundi 115 lyali mu kiseera ekisookerwako ekyokukulaakulanyizibwa, 78 ku lyo lyakakasibwa nga pulojekiti ezigenda mu maaso (79, okusinziira ku Milken Institute), n’eddala 37 eryalangirirwa, naye nga tewali bubaka bumala mu lwatu obulikwatako (kirowoozebwa okuba nga bakyali mu kuteekateeka oba nga bakyabaga).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okw’omutendera I-II okugezesa kubaamu okukola okunoonyereza okusookerwako okulaba oba mulimu obulabe n’okugezesa okugema, kubaamu okulondoba okw’okulabiraawo, mubaamu okukozesa eddagala lya kiguumaaza, kukolebwa mu bifo bingi, nga bwe balaba doozi ezisinga okukola obulungi.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okw’omutendera III kubeeramu abeetabi bangiko nga mulimu n’ekibinja ekigeraageranyizibwako n’okugezesa okulaba eddagala bwe likola okuziyiza obulwadde, nga bwe balondoola okukosa okuva mu kukozesa doozi esingayo obunene.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: KU ddagala erigema 79 eriruubirirwa eiri mu kukulaakulanyizibwa (eryakakasibwa mu Gwokuna 2020 nga gutandika), 74 lyali terinnatuuka ku kwkalirizibwa mu bantu (likyali ku "kunoonyereza ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Awo nga 24 Janwali 2020 mu Australia, University of Queensland yalangirira nti linoonyereza ku busobosi bwa molecular clamp vaccine eryandiyinzizza okukyusa endagabutonde ya viral proteins olwo obusibage buzuukusibwe.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Awo nga 24 Janwali 2020 mu Canada, International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) ku University of Saskatchewan kyalangirira entandikwa y’omulimu gw’okuzuula eddagala erigema, nga bateebereza okutandika okugezesa mu bantu mu 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Pulojekiti y’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema kwalangirirwa ku Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention nga 26 Janwali 2020, ne University of Hong Kong nga 28 Janwali.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Awo nga 29 Janwali 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, nga bakulemberwa Hanneke Schuitemaker, baalangirira nti baali batandise omulimu gw’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen ekolera wamu ne Vaxart okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema erimiribwa nga bakozea biotechnology.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Nga 18 Ogwokusatu 2020, Emergent BioSolutions kyalangirira okukola eddagala nga kikolera wamu ne Vaxart okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Nga 8 Ogwokubiri 2020, eggezeserezo lya OncoGen mu Romania lyafulumya olupapula ku nkola y’eddagala erigema nga likozesa tekinologiya y’omu n’oyo ow’eryo erijjanjaba kookolo (cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy).

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Nga 25 Ogwokusatu ssenkulu w’okunoonyereza mu kitongole ky’okunoonyereza yalangirira nti baali bamaliriza okwekaliriza eddagala erigema era nga bagenda kutandika okugezesa.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Nga 27 Ogwokubiri 2020, kampuni ya Generex entono, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, yalangirira etandise pulojeki y’okutondawo Ii-Key peptide vaccine okulwanyisa COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Baali baagala okukola eddagala erigema eriyinza okugezesebwa mu bantu "mu nnaku 90."

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokusatu 2020, Washington University mu St. Louis yalangirira pulojekiti yaayo ey’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokusatu 2020, United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command e Fort Detrick ne Walter Reed Army Institute of Research mu Silver Spring, byonna nga biri mu Maryland ey’obugwanjuba, byalangirira nti bikola ku ddagala erigema.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Awo nga 10 Ogwokusatu 2020, Emergent Biosolutions kyalangirira nti kyali kikoze omukago ne Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: mu kukulaakulanya n’okufulumya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Aboomukago era baalangirira enteekateeka z’okugeza ng’okunoonyereza kw’ekisawo tekunnaba n’Okunoonyereza kw’Omutendera I okutandika mu Gwomusanvu 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 12 Ogwokusatu 2020, Ministule ya Indida ey’obulamu yalangirira bakola ne isolates 11, era nti ne bwe baba nga banguye nnyo kijja kutwala waakiri omwaka gumu n’ekitundu oba emyaka ebiri okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Nga 12 Ogwokusatu 2020, Medicago, kampuni eya biotechnology Quebec City, Quebec, yagamba nti ekulaakulanya coronavirus-like particle ng’esasulirwako ssente ntono okuva mu Canadian Institutes for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Eddagala eriruubirirwa okugenda liri mu kugezesa kw’omu ggezeserezo mu kunoonyereza, ng’okuzesa mu bantu kutegekeddwa mu Gwomusanvu oba mu Gwomunaana 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Mu nnaku ezaasooka mu wiiki eyo, The Guardian lwalangirira nti Pulezidenti wa Amerika Donald Trump yali awadde CureVac "'ssente eziwera' okukola okunoonyereza okw’enjawulo ku ddagala erigema Covid-19", ekintu kino gavumenti ya Bugirimaanyi yakiwakanya.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Nga 17 Ogwokusatu 2020, kampuni ya America enkozi y’eddagala Pfizer yalangirira omukago ne kampuni ya Bugirimaanni BioNTech okukolera awamu okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema eryesigamiziddwa ku mRNA.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: eddagala erigema eryesigamiziddwa ku mRNA eriruubirirwa BNT162, era nga kati liri mu kugezesa ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba era okugeza kusuubira okutandika mu Gwokuna 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: Mu Italy nhs 17 Ogwokusatu 2020, Takis Biotech, kampuni ya Italian eya biotech yalangirira nti ejja kubeera n’okunooyereza okusooka ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba mu Gwokuna 2020 era eddagala lyabwe erigema eriruubirirwa liyinza okutandika okugezesebwa mu bantu mu Gwomwenda.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: Mu Bufransa nga 19 March 2020, Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) kyalangirira nti kyali kitadde obukadde US$4.9 mukago gw’okunoonyereza ku ddagala erigema COVID-19 omuli Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), ne University of Pittsburgh, ne kiteeka omugatte gwa CEPI's mu kunoonyereza ku ddagala erigema COVID-19 ku bukadde US$29.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Awalala CEPI w’atadde ssente z’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema COVID-19 mwe muli Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, University of Hong Kong, University of Oxford, ne University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
