targetString: Wabula, wadde nga Wuhan Institute of Virology, bawagira okumira doozi emu buli lunaku eweza gulaamu emu, balabula nti bw’okubisaamu mu doozi eyo kya bulabe nnyo era kiyinza okukutta.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: Nga 28 Ogwokusatu 2020, FDA yayisa ekiragiro eky’amangu ngekkiriza okukozesa hydroxychloroquine ne chloroquine nga basinziira ku kuwabula kw’abasawo abajjanjaba abalwadde ba COVID-19. Olufulumya olwo 7 lw’ebigobererwa Abachina era lugattako interferon, ribavirin oba umifenovir mu kujjanjaba COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Ebyakazuulibwawo biraga nti doozi ennyingi eza ribavirin zeetaagisa okutangira SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Nitazoxanide awagiddwa okwongera okunoonyerezebwako mu bintu ebiramu oluvannyuma lw’okwolesa obunafu mu kutangira SARS- CoV-2. Ebizuuliddwa biraga nti initial spike protein priming eya transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) ya mugaso nnyo okuyingiza SARS-CoV-2 nga yeegatta ne ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Okunoonyereza ku chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine nga mulimu oba temuli azithromycin zirina obunafu bungi obulemesezza abasawo okukkiriza okukozesa obujjanjabi buno nga tebwongedde kunoonyerezebwako. Oseltamivir takugira SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro era omugaso tegumanyiddwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: Cytokine storm buyinza okuba obukosefu obw’amaanyi nga COVID-19 anyiinyitidde.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Waliwo obukakafu nti hydroxychloroquine ayinza okubaamu ebirungo bya anti-cytokine storm properties. Tocilizumab ateereddwa mu bigobererwa aba China National Health Commission okujjanjaba oluvannyuma lw’okukola okunoonyereza okutonotono.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Eri ku mutendera 2 ogw’okugezesa okwetegekere ku mutendera gw’eggwanga mu Italy oluvannyuma lw’okulaga obubonero bw’obulwadde mu bantu abayi.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Kati ligattiddwamu serum ferritin blood test okuzuula cytokine storms, era nga ligenderera kutangira bintu nga bino, ebirowoozebwa okutta abalwadde abamu.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: Interleukin-6 receptor antagonist yakakasibwa ekitongole kya FDA nga beesigama ku kunoonyereza okw’emabega okujjanjaba steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome ereetebwa ekintu ekirala, CAR T cell therapy, mu 2017.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Okutuusa leero, tewali bukakafu bwa nkukunala nti tocilizumab ajjanjaba n’awonya CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Okukyusa abasirikale b’omubiri abalongooseddwa n’okugattibwa nga bakoleddwa omuyungo gw’obusibage ogw’abo abawonye COVID-19 ne bateekebwa mu bantu ababeetaaga kyekennenyezebwa ng’enkola etangira obulwadde ng’omuntu tagemeddwa.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Enkola eno yagezesebwa ku SARS naye nga ebyazuulibwa tebyali bya nkomeredde.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Okunafuya obuwuka y’enkola ey’okujjanjaba nga ekozesa obuwuka bu kyesirikidde okulwanyisa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Enkola endala wabula, nga antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity ne/oba phagocytosis, zisoboka.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Enkola endala ey’okujjanjabisa abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde ba kyesirikidde, okugeza, okukozesa abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde abaweeseddwa abayitibwa monoclonal, bali mu kukolebwa.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: Okukola convalescent serum, omuli omusaayi okuva ku balwadde abawonye era mulimu abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde ezireetebwa akawuka kano, kusobola okwongerwako okusobola okwongera ku kukukola eddagala.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Endwadde za Coronavirus, ekibinja ky’obubonero obufaanagana

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, dokita mu Central Hospital e Wuhan, oluvannyuma yakwatibwa obulwadde bwa COVID-19 era n’ekyavaamu n’afa ng’amaze okumanyisa ku nsaasaana y’akawuka ako.
